com.kontakt.sdk.android.manager

Class BeaconManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kontakt.sdk.android.connection.AbstractServiceConnector
      • com.kontakt.sdk.android.manager.BeaconManager

  • public class BeaconManager
extends AbstractServiceConnector
    Beacon Manager collaborates with Beacon Service (BeaconService) and delegates actions to it. The manager builds Configuration (BeaconManager.Configuration) which is applied to the service after successful connection. The manager is responsible for both monitoring and ranging enabling.

    Android L brings significant changes to BLE scan by affecting the scan performance itself and by providing devices filtering feature. Therefore we decided to split BeaconManager's backing services into two versions working respectively to Android OS version that device is running on:

    • BeaconService acts as a backing service for devices running on Build.VERSION_CODES.KITKAT_WATCH and lower
    • BeaconServiceL acts as a backing service for devices running on Build.VERSION_CODES.LOLLIPOP and higher

    In version 1.0.2 we introduced Beacons filtering as it is a feature that comes with Android L.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BeaconManager.Configuration
      Each of the managers has its own configuration which is built and delivered to collaborating Service.
      static interface  BeaconManager.MonitoringListener
      Monitoring listener provides callbacks for monitoring process performed by Beacon Manager (BeaconManager).
      static interface  BeaconManager.RangingListener
      Ranging listener provides callback method indicating found Beacon within previously specified Region (Region).

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_KONTAKT_BEACON_PROXIMITY_UUID

        public static UUID DEFAULT_KONTAKT_BEACON_PROXIMITY_UUID
        The constant DEFAULT_KONTAKT_BEACON_PROXIMITY_UUID. This proximity UUID value is preset as the default for every Beacon bought at kontakt.io.

      • SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER

        public static final int SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER
        Perform Bluetooth LE scan in low power mode. This is the default scan mode as it consumes the least power.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCAN_MODE_BALANCED

        public static final int SCAN_MODE_BALANCED
        Perform Bluetooth LE scan in balanced power mode. Scan results are returned at a rate that provides a good trade-off between scan frequency and power consumption.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY

        public static final int SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY
        Scan using highest duty cycle. It's recommended to only use this mode when the application is running in the foreground.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setDistanceSort

        public void setDistanceSort(BeaconDevice.DistanceSort distanceSort)
        Sets BeaconDevice.DistanceSort parameter on @BeaconManager.Configuration.Builder. The parameter indicates in which order the found Beacons List should be delivered to callback method.

        By default, distance sort is disabled so beacons are delivered in an order in which they become visible to the device. In order to enable beacons sorting, you must set desired distance sort parameter

        This parameter should be applied if desired before invoking startMonitoring/startRanging methods.

        If not set, the DistanceSort.DISABLED parameter is applied which does not enable beacons sorting by distance

        Parameters:
        distanceSort - the distance sort

      • setBeaconActivityCheckConfiguration

        public void setBeaconActivityCheckConfiguration(BeaconActivityCheckConfiguration beaconActivityCheckConfiguration)
        Sets BeaconActivityCheckConfiguration on @BeaconManager.Configuration.Builder.

        By default, the removal configuration is disabled and beacons which signal's strength becomes unidentifiable remain in the delivered list.

        Filtering active beacons list by applying removal configuration gives more reliable relation to real beacons surrounding in particular moment.

        This parameter should be applied if desired before invoking startMonitoring/startRanging methods.

        If not set, the RemovalConfiguration with unacceptable values is applied and thus the functionality is disabled.

        Parameters:
        beaconActivityCheckConfiguration - the removal configuration

      • setActionController

        public void setActionController(ActionController controller)
        Sets ActionController on BeaconManager.Configuration.Builder

        By setting ActionController you enable interaction with ActionManager.

        Please note that in order to successfully access Action controller, you must connect Managers to services in specific order: the Action manager as the first and the Beacon manager as the second one.

        This parameter should be applied if desired before invoking startMonitoring/startRanging methods.

        When initializing the BeaconManager.Configuration, the Action Controller (whether set or not) is wrapped by ActionController

        Parameters:
        controller - the ActionController

        The limit of included filters is 10.

      • setScanMode

        public void setScanMode(int scanMode)
        Sets Scan Mode. Android L comes with functionality controlling scan performance. there are three predefined variables according to which device scan may be handled depending on user's choice. Our SDK takes advantage fo this feature for devices running on Android Lollipop and higher. For devices running on Android OS with version lower than Lollipop this parameter does not affect scan performance in either way.

        You can set one of three values:

        SCAN_MODE_BALANCED SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER

        Parameters:
        scanMode - the scan mode

      • registerRangingListener

        public void registerRangingListener(BeaconManager.RangingListener listener)
        Sets BeaconManager.RangingListener on BeaconManager.Configuration.Builder.

        The listener is responsible for notifying about ranged beacons.

        If not set, the RangingListener.NULL_RANGING_LISTENER is applied to the configuration which does not inform about anything.

        This parameter should be applied before invoking startRanging method.

        Parameters:
        listener - the

      • registerMonitoringListener

        public void registerMonitoringListener(BeaconManager.MonitoringListener listener)
        Sets BeaconManager.MonitoringListener on BeaconManager.Configuration.Builder.

        The listener is responsible for notifying about monitored beacons.

        If not set, the MonitoringListener.NULL_MONITORING_LISTENER is applied to the configuration which does not inform about anything.

        This parameter should be applied before invoking startMonitoring methods.

        Parameters:
        listener - - the

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()

      • startRanging

        public void startRanging()
                  throws RemoteException
        Starts ranging all visible beacons regardless of their belonging to any Region. This method may cause poor performance once the Android device finds multiple Beacons at the same time. Therefore, consider applying filters during Beacon Manager configuration.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - - the remote exception is thrown when ranging start failes.

      • startRanging

        public void startRanging(Set<Region> region)
                  throws RemoteException
        Start ranging for the desired set of regions (Region)
        Parameters:
        region - - the region set.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - - the remote exception is thrown when ranging start failes.

      • stopRanging

        public void stopRanging()
        Stop ranging beacons. The method is thread safe.

        The method is thread-safe.

      • startMonitoring

        public void startMonitoring()
                     throws RemoteException
        Starts beacons monitoring regardless of their belonging to any Region. This method may cause poor performance once the Android device finds multiple Beacons at the same time. Therefore, consider applying filters during Beacon Manager configuration.

        The method is thread-safe.

        Throws:
        RemoteException - the remote exception

      • startMonitoring

        public void startMonitoring(Set<Region> regions)
                     throws RemoteException
        Starts beacons monitoring. In order to start monitoring you specify desired set of regions
        Parameters:
        regions - - desired regions set
        Throws:
        RemoteException - the remote exception

      • stopMonitoring

        public void stopMonitoring()
        Stops beacons monitoring. If BeaconManager does not monitor beacons, nothing happens.

        The method is thread-safe.

        Disconnects the connector from backing service.
